title: FAKE Alert: Home Ministry has not directed the states to re-open schools | Newsmobile
author: newsmobile.in
vclaim:
A picture post, showing a screengrab of India News, is doing the rounds on the internet. It is being claimed that the Union Home Ministry has given permission to all states to re-open schools.

The post comes at a time when Coronavirus cases in India are skyrocketing, therefore, enraging social media users.

The caption of the post reads: ‘गृह मंत्रलाय ने सभी राज्यों को स्कूल खोलने की परमिशन दे दी है, इससे पहले विधानसभा व संसद खुले हमारे बच्चे कोई टेस्टिंग किट नही है।‘

NewsMobile fact-checked the above claim and found it to be FAKE.

Government sources confirmed that no such move has been made by the authorities and the claims are baseless.

In fact, the Press Information Bureau (PIB) in a tweet, explicitly clarified, that this information is untrue and all educational institutes are closed throughout the country as per orders of the Ministry of Home Affairs. Claim-A purported screen grab circulating on social media claims that Home Ministry has permitted all states to open schools#PIBFactCheck– All educational institutes are closed throughout country as per orders of Ministry of Home Affairs. In conclusion, it is clear that the claim being made is FALSE.
